thread.title: Review: ANZ Qantas Frequent Flyer Black American Express, Visa credit cards - Airlines | flights | hotels | travel tech | style | apps
thread.title_full: Review: ANZ Qantas Frequent Flyer Black American Express, Visa credit cards - Airlines | flights | hotels | travel tech | style | apps - Australian Business Traveller

author: ausbt.com.au
title: Review: ANZ Qantas Frequent Flyer Black American Express, Visa credit cards - Airlines | flights | hotels | travel tech | style | apps
text:
Combining two credit cards on the one account, ANZ's Qantas Frequent Flyer Black product comes with an American Express card to earn maximum Qantas frequent flyer points where it's accepted, as well as a backup Visa to continue earning some points everywhere else.
It also provides more travel perks than you could poke a stick at, including lounge access via Qantas, American Express and Velocé, a substantial discount on ongoing Qantas Club membership and of course, free international travel insurance.
Closer to home, ANZ's optional eDine program unlocks discounts of up to 50% at hotels and 20% at restaurants to keep you covered wherever you may travel to.
ANZ Frequent Flyer Black cards: fast facts Grade/tier: Above-platinum Card type: American Express + Visa Loyalty program: Qantas Frequent Flyer Qantas Points earned per dollar – American Express: 1.5 Qantas Points earned per dollar – Visa: 0.75 Bonus points earned per dollar on eligible Qantas spend: 1 Points capping: Uncapped Fees, charges and interest: 4/5 Total annual fee: $425^ Additional/supplementary cardholder fee: $65^ with rewards Interest rate on purchases: 19.99% p.a. Interest-free days on purchases: Up to 55 Interest rate on cash advances: 21.49% p.a. International transaction fee: 3.0% Minimum income requirement: $75,000 p.a. Minimum credit limit: $15,000
^ Currently waived in the first year
Earning points for free flights: 5/5 Spend at least $7,500 in the first three months of holding a new ANZ Frequent Flyer Black account and you'll be rewarded with a bonus 75,000 Qantas Points in addition to the points you'd normally earn on your everyday spend.
When combined, that's more than enough for a return upgrade from discount economy to Qantas business class between Australia and either Singapore or Hong Kong, or for a one-way economy flight from Sydney to London, plus taxes and fees.
Airport lounge access: 5/5 Cardholders can request two free Qantas Club lounge passes each year – valid in domestic Qantas Club lounges and the airline's international business class lounges – and can enjoy two free yearly visits to the American Express Sydney Airport lounge .
Flash your ANZ Frequent Flyer Black AMEX for lounge access at Sydney Airport For more frequent travellers, Qantas Club membership can also be purchased via ANZ for just $400/year (down from $895 for newcomers), while unlimited access is also provided to lounges in the Velocé international network such as in Auckland, Singapore and Hong Kong.
Free international travel insurance: 5/5 Charge just $250 of your international flight, accommodation or other associated costs to either Frequent Flyer Black card and ANZ's free travel insurance has you covered on trips of up to six months. Interstate flight inconvenience insurance and rental car excess cover are also available.
ANZ Frequent Flyer Black: our verdict For frequent flyer points alone, NAB's Qantas Rewards Premium cards provide a similar earning rate for a lower $250 ongoing annual fee, although with ANZ's deal offering no annual fee in the first year, discounts on Qantas Club membership and unlimited lounge access, ANZ Frequent Flyer Black could well pay for itself in years two and beyond.
The only major downside? Both the Commonwealth Diamond Awards and Westpac Altitude Black cards provide complimentary Starwood Preferred Guest Gold status after staying with the chain for just one night, which in turn provides perks such as hotel room upgrades and bonus points.
Also read: ANZ Qantas Frequent Flyer Platinum credit card review
